Math.text: 0 less= (P _ c) ^ prime * 0 = n * cosine@(n * alpha) - S ^ prime * 0 less= n * cosine@(n * alpha) = n * square-root@(1 - (sine ^ 2)@(n * alpha)) = n * square-root@(1 - P _ c * 0 ^ 2)

para.p: Thus

para.p: or

para.p: Because

The following is a version of Bernstein’s inequality. 3 3 footnote 3 Ronald A. DeVore and George G. Lorentz, Constructive Approximation, p. 101, Theorem 2.4.

If
∈ T
T n

para.p: which we can write as

Math.text: Q * x = (integral _ T)@(chi _ A * t * (sum _ j)@(widehat@(T) * j * e ^ (i * j * (t + x)) * sgn * T ^ prime * t * d * t))
Q * x

para.p: DeVore and Lorentz attribute the following inequality to Sergey Nikolsky. 4 4 footnote 4 Ronald A. DeVore and George G. Lorentz, Constructive Approximation, p. 102, Theorem 2.6.

T n
and

≥ r
q 2
an integer,

absent = square-root@(2 * m + 1) * ((norm@(T)) _ infinity) ^ (r - q / 2) * ((norm@(T)) _ q) ^ (q / 2)
absent = square-root@(2 * m + 1) * ((norm@(T)) _ infinity) ^ (r - q / 2) * ((norm@(T)) _ q) ^ (q / 2)

Bernstein’s inequality is a statement about functions whose Fourier transform is supported only on low frequencies. The following is a statement about functions whose Fourier transform is supported only on high frequencies. 5 5 footnote 5 Yitzhak Katznelson, An Introduction to Harmonic Analysis, third ed., p. 55, Theorem 8.4. In particular, for
1 ≤ p < ∞

≥ j n
,

Math.text: widehat@(Phi _ n) * j = ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ infinity)@(widehat@(Phi _ (list@(n, k))) * j * widehat@(phi _ (list@(1, n * 2 ^ k))) * j) = (1 / j) * ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ infinity)@(widehat@(Phi _ (list@(n, k))) * j) = 1 / j

para.p: As well,

Math.text: (norm@(Phi _ n)) _ 1 less= ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ infinity)@((norm@(Psi _ (list@(n, k)) * phi _ (list@(1, n * 2 ^ k)))) _ 1) less= ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ infinity)@((norm@(Psi _ (list@(n, k)))) _ 1 * (norm@(phi _ (list@(1, n * 2 ^ k)))) _ 1) less= (3 / 2) * ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ infinity)@(2 * (n * 2 ^ k) ^ (- 1)) = 6 / n

para.p: We now define

Math.text: d * mu _ (list@(1, n)) * t = (1 / (2 * pi)) * (Phi _ n * t - Phi _ n * (- t)) * d * t

para.p:
which satisfies for
≥
| j |
n
,

Math.text: widehat@(mu _ (list@(1, n))) * j = widehat@(Phi _ n) * j - widehat@(Phi _ n) * (- j) = 1 / j

para.p: and hence

Math.text: widehat@(f ^ prime * mu _ (list@(1, n))) * j = widehat@(f ^ prime) * j * widehat@(mu _ (list@(1, n))) * j = (i * j * hat@(f) * j) cdot (1 / j) = i * hat@(f) * j

para.p:
Because
=
⁢
^ f
( j )
0
for
<
| j |
n
,
=
⁢
^
*
f ′
μ
1 , n
( j )
0
for
<
| j |
n
, it follows that for any
∈ j Z
,

Math.text: widehat@(f ^ prime * mu _ (list@(1, n))) * j = i * hat@(f) * j

para.p: and therefore,

Math.text: f ^ prime * mu _ (list@(1, n)) = i * f

para.p: Then

Math.text: (norm@(f)) _ B = (norm@(i * f)) _ B = (norm@(f ^ prime * mu _ (list@(1, n)))) _ B less= (norm@(mu _ (list@(1, n)))) _ (M * T) * (norm@(f ^ prime)) _ B less= 2 * (norm@(Phi _ n)) _ 1 * (norm@(f ^ prime)) _ B less= (12 / n) * (norm@(f ^ prime)) _ B

para.p:
That is, with
=
C 1
12
we have

Math.text: (norm@(f)) _ B less= 12 * n ^ (- 1) * (norm@(f ^ prime)) _ B

para.p:
For
= m
+
⁢ 2 ν
1
, we define

Math.text: mu _ (list@(m, n)) = mu _ (list@(1, n)) * mu _ (list@(2 * nu, n))

para.p:
for which we have, for
≥
| j |
n
,

Math.text: widehat@(f ^ m * mu _ (list@(m, n))) * j = (i * j) ^ m * hat@(f) * j * widehat@(mu _ (list@(1, n))) * j * widehat@(mu _ (list@(2 * nu, n))) * j = ((i * j) ^ m * hat@(f) * j) cdot (1 / j) cdot j ^ (- 2 * nu) = i ^ m * hat@(f) * j

para.p: It follows that

Math.text: f ^ m * mu _ (list@(m, n)) = i ^ m * f

para.p: whence

Math.text: (norm@(f)) _ B = (norm@(i ^ m * f)) _ B
(norm@(f)) _ B
absent = (norm@(i ^ m * f)) _ B
absent = (norm@(f ^ m * mu _ (list@(m, n)))) _ B
absent = (norm@(f ^ m * mu _ (list@(m, n)))) _ B
absent less= (norm@(mu _ (list@(m, n)))) _ (M * T) * (norm@(f ^ m)) _ B
absent less= (norm@(mu _ (list@(m, n)))) _ (M * T) * (norm@(f ^ m)) _ B
absent less= (norm@(mu _ (list@(1, n)))) _ (M * T) * (norm@(mu _ (list@(2 * nu, n)))) _ (M * T) * (norm@(f ^ m)) _ B
absent less= (norm@(mu _ (list@(1, n)))) _ (M * T) * (norm@(mu _ (list@(2 * nu, n)))) _ (M * T) * (norm@(f ^ m)) _ B
absent less= ((12 / n) cdot (2 * nu + 1)) * n ^ (- 2 * nu) * (norm@(f ^ m)) _ B
absent less= ((12 / n) cdot (2 * nu + 1)) * n ^ (- 2 * nu) * (norm@(f ^ m)) _ B
absent = 12 * m * n ^ (- m) * (norm@(f ^ m)) _ B
absent = 12 * m * n ^ (- m) * (norm@(f ^ m)) _ B

para.p:
That is, with
=
C m
⁢ 12 m
, we have

Math.text: (norm@(f)) _ B less= C _ m * n ^ (- m) * (norm@(f ^ m)) _ B

para.p: completing the proof. ∎
